### Testing kubectl exec POD COMMAND
### Test execute non-existing POD
! exec kubectl exec abc --namespace ${NAMESPACE} -- date
# POD abc should error since it doesn't exist
stderr 'pods "abc" not found'

### Test execute multiple resources
! exec kubectl exec -f pods.yaml --namespace ${NAMESPACE} -- echo test
stderr 'cannot exec into multiple objects at a time'

### Test execute existing POD
# Create test-pod
exec kubectl create -f ${K8S_ROOT}/hack/testdata/pod.yaml --namespace ${NAMESPACE}
# Execute existing POD
! exec kubectl exec test-pod date --namespace ${NAMESPACE}
# POD test-pod is exists this is shouldn't have output not found
! stderr 'pods "test-pod" not found'
# These must be pass the validate
! stderr 'pod or type/name must be specified'

# Clean up
exec kubectl delete pods test-pod --namespace ${NAMESPACE}

### Testing kubectl exec TYPE/NAME COMMAND

### Test execute invalid resource type
! exec kubectl exec foo/bar --namespace ${NAMESPACE} -- date
stderr 'error:'

### Test execute non-existing resources
! exec kubectl exec deployments/bar --namespace ${NAMESPACE} -- date
# resource type foo should error since it doesn't exist
stderr '"bar" not found'

exec kubectl create -f ${K8S_ROOT}/hack/testdata/pod.yaml --namespace ${NAMESPACE}
exec kubectl create -f ${K8S_ROOT}/hack/testdata/frontend-replicaset.yaml --namespace ${NAMESPACE}
exec kubectl create -f ${K8S_ROOT}/hack/testdata/configmap.yaml --namespace ${NAMESPACE}

### Test execute non-implemented resources
! exec kubectl exec configmap/test-set-env-config --namespace ${NAMESPACE} -- date 2>&1)
# resource type configmap should error since configmap not implemented to be attached
stderr 'not implemented'

### Test execute exists and valid resource type.
# Just check the output, since test-cmd not run kubelet, pod never be assigned.
# and not really can run `kubectl exec` command

! exec kubectl exec pods/test-pod --namespace ${NAMESPACE} -- date
# POD test-pod is exists this is shouldn't have output not found
! stderr 'not found'
# These must be pass the validate
! stderr 'pod, type/name or --filename must be specified'

exec kubectl get --namespace ${NAMESPACE} replicaset/frontend
exec kubectl get --namespace ${NAMESPACE} pods
! exec kubectl exec replicaset/frontend --namespace ${NAMESPACE} -- date
# Replicaset frontend is valid and exists will select the first pod.
# and Shouldn't have output not found
! stderr 'not found'
# These must be pass the validate
! stderr 'pod, type/name or --filename must be specified'

# Clean up
exec kubectl delete pods/test-pod --namespace ${NAMESPACE}
exec kubectl delete replicaset/frontend --namespace ${NAMESPACE}
exec kubectl delete configmap/test-set-env-config --namespace ${NAMESPACE}
